text: The <extra_id_0> interleukin-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / receptor interaction activates <extra_id_0> Lyn <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Jak2 tyrosine kinases <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and propagates signals via the Ras - <extra_id_0> Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - MAP kinase and the Jak-STAT pathways in eosinophils .

We have shown that the interaction of <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with the receptor activates <extra_id_0> Lyn tyrosine kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> within 1 min and <extra_id_0> Jak2 tyrosine kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> within 1-3 min .
<extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also stimulates GTP binding to <extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The signal is subsequently propagated through the activation of <extra_id_0> Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , MEK , and MAP kinases as shown by their increased autophosphorylation in vitro and phosphorylation in situ .
<extra_id_0> Jak2 kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to phosphorylate STAT nuclear proteins .
The activation of STAT nuclear factors was studied by electrophoretic mobility shift assay using a gamma activation site ( GAS ) probe .
We found that <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces two GAS - binding proteins in eosinophils , one of which is STAT1 .

We conclude that <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced signals are propagated through two distinct pathways : ( 1 ) <extra_id_0> Lyn <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> -- > Ras -- > <extra_id_0> Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> -- > MEK -- > MAP kinase and ( 2 ) <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> -- > STAT1 .
